head.title: Treasury to Sell Bills and Note

hedline.hl1: Treasury to Sell Bills and Note

block.p: The Treasury's schedule of financing this week includes today's weekly auction of new three- and six-month bills and a two-year note being auctioned on Wednesday.

According to traders, at the close of the New York cash market on Friday, the rate on the outstanding three-month bill was 4.81 percent, and the six-month issue was 4.73 percent. In when-issued trading, the two-year note was offered at a price to yield 4.67 percent.
The Treasury's schedule of financing this week includes today's weekly auction of new three- and six-month bills and a two-year note being auctioned on Wednesday.

According to traders, at the close of the New York cash market on Friday, the rate on the outstanding three-month bill was 4.81 percent, and the six-month issue was 4.73 percent. In when-issued trading, the two-year note was offered at a price to yield 4.67 percent.
The following taxable and tax-exempt fixed-income issues are scheduled for pricing this week:
TAXABLE ONE DAY DURING THE WEEK
Pulte Corp., $200 million of notes due in 2011, Baa3/BBB/---. BancAmerica Securities and Bank One.
Source: MCM CorporateWatch
Ratings: Moody's Investors Service/ Standard & Poor's/Duff & Phelps Credit.
TAX EXEMPT TUESDAY
Nashville Metro Government, $526.1 million of general obligation bonds. Competitive.
WEDNESDAY Maryland, $200 million of general obligation bonds. Competitive.
Overland Park, Kan., $52.1 million of general obligation bonds. Competitive.
Rutherford County, Tenn., $74.2 million of general obligation bonds. Competitive.
THURSDAY Mississippi, $61 million of general obligation bonds. Competitive.
New York State Certificate, $57.4 million of debt securities. Competitive.
ONE DAY DURING THE WEEK California PCR, $200 million of debt securities for Pacific Gas and Electric. Goldman, Sachs & Co.
Carrollton Independent School District, Tex., $111.9 million of debt securities. PaineWebber Inc.
Jacksonville Electric Authority, $145 million of water and sewer revenue bonds. Lehman Brothers.
Kentucky Turnpike, $59.7 million of debt securities. PaineWebber Inc.
New York City Transit Finance Agency, $415 million of debt securities. Bear, Stearns & Co.
Oregon, $150 million of certificate of participation. Bear, Stearns & Co.
